title: Fidelity Bank holds 1st draw of Save for Gold Promo
text:
23:00 CET Fidelity Bank holds 1st draw of Save for Gold Promo By GNA 
Accra, Oct. 20, GNA - Fidelity Bank in collaboration with the National Lotteries Authority has announced 17 lucky customers as winners of the first monthly draw of the Bank's 'Save for Gold' promotion in Kumasi. 
A statement issued by Mr Jim Baiden, Deputy Managing Director of Fidelity Bank, disclosed that the draw had Evelyn Biney of Lapaz Branch as the first winner of three Gold coins, followed by David Ahiable of Ashaiman branch with two gold coins. 
Fifteen other winners including Reindorf Yemoh Odoi of Airport Branch, Wisdom Ofori-Attah of Hohoe branch and Ivy Yeboaa Adjei of Nkawkaw post branch won a Gold coin each. 
Addressing the audience, Mr Jim Baiden, Deputy Managing Director of Fidelity Bank said it is important to save with the Bank as it is their core objective to help customers save for future plans. 
'At Fidelity Bank, we believe in the culture of savings to achieve one's goal and also as a fall back plan for a rainy day. 
'We continually encourage our customers in particular and the … public to cultivate the habit of saving consistently towards achieving their plans and securing the future of their loved ones,' he said. 
Explaining why Fidelity is rewarding customers with Gold prizes instead of other products, Mr Baiden noted that the Bank believes in giving the consumer the purchasing power to decide what they want to do with their prizes. 
'With this Promotion, we are giving lucky customers the opportunity to win the precious mineral-Gold because with a Gold coin or Gold bar, is something one can keep for investment purposes or convert into cash for other purposes such as expansion of business, construction of a dream house or buy, and funding of their children's education.' 
Mr Baiden congratulated all 17 winners of the first draw and encouraged Ghanaians to participate in the promo to stand a chance of winning. 
He used the Dinner Draw platform to express the Bank's appreciation to its customers in Kumasi. 
'This evening's event has been organised with you in mind to honour and celebrate you our cherished customers in Kumasi for banking with us and to say a big thank you for the special way you have impacted our business. It has been a pleasure to have served you these past years and we look forward to more rewarding years together.' 
The statement observed that Mr Kojo Bonsu, Metropolitan Chief Executive of Kumasi, acknowledged the Bank's efforts to encourage savings among the Ghanaian populace. 
Mr Bonsu said: 'Many have seen this Save for Gold Promo but have not seen a one kilogram 24 karat Gold bar before. I will open an account with Fidelity Bank and hope that I win or somebody from Kumasi wins the ultimate prize'. 
He commended the Bank for setting up 11 branches in Kumasi within a short period of existence and urged them to open more branches in the Ashanti Region to boost employment. 
The Fidelity Bank 'Save for Gold' promo was launched in August 2015 and would be running till February 2016. 
There are four more monthly draws and a grand draw to be held with more than GH ¢ 500,000.00 worth of Gold prizes for the Bank's customers. 
GNA
